required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Comparison of the Efficacy of Gingival Unit Graft With Connective Tissue Graft in Root Coverage
clinical_study.official_title: The Comparison of the Efficacy of Gingival Unit Graft With Connective Tissue Graft in Root Coverage: A Randomized Split-Mouth Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare the clinical effectiveness of gingival unit graft (GUG) and connective tissues graft (CTG) in Miller's class I and II gingival recession.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who accept the study have provided information about the study and required a written informed consent form. The clinical effectiveness of two different periodontal surgical techniques (gingival unit graft and connective tissue graft) in gingival recessions will be evaluated. Periodontal measurements (gingival recession, keratinized gingiva height) and patient-reported outcomes (intra and post-operative pain, patient satisfaction and hypersensitivity) are defined.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Gingival Recession Depth at 6 month
primary_outcome.description: The gingival recession depth consists of the distance from the cement-enamel junction to the most apical extension of the gingival margin. The measurement is recorded in millimeters. Change= (6 month score-baseline score)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Keratinized Gingiva Height at 6 month
primary_outcome.description: Keratinized gingiva height, measured as the distance from the gingival margin to the mucogingival line. The measurement is recorded in millimeters. Change= (6 month score-baseline score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Root Hypersensitivity at 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: Root hypersensitivity at baseline and post-operative 6 month utilizing a visual numerical scale (VNS) test are defined. Possible scores range from (0=no sensitive and 10= worst possible sensitive). Change= (6 month score-baseline score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Patient Satisfaction at 6 month
secondary_outcome.description: The patient satisfaction with the gingiva position, structure and color of the gingival recessions sites utilizing a VNS test (0=not satisfied and 10=very satisfied) are defined. Possible scores range from 0 (not satisfied) to 10 (very satisfied). Change= (6 month score-baseline score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Pain at 1 week
secondary_outcome.description: Pain perception of the surgery at intra and post-operative period (week 1) utilizing a VNS test are defined. Possible scores range from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Change= (1 week score-baseline score)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline Pain at 2 week
secondary_outcome.description: Pain perception of the surgery at intra and post-operative period (week 2) utilizing a VNS test are defined. Possible scores range from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst possible pain). Change= (2 week score-baseline score)

arm_group.description: For test group, gingival recessions were treated with gingival unit graft.
For Control group, gingival recessions were treated with connective tissue graft.

intervention.description: Gingival unit graft Connective tissue graft

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Systemic healthy individuals
- Presence Miller's class I and II gingival recession in the anterior and premolar teeth
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Pregnancy
- Lactation
- Any cardiovascular, renal or hepatic conditions
- History of periodontal surgery
- Tooth mobility
- Presence of probing depth >3 mm and caries or restorations in the teeth undergoing treatment
